# Preface {.unnumbered}

## About This Research

This statistical report presents a comprehensive analysis of the Offender Tracking Information System (OTIS) data, specifically examining restrictive confinement practices in Ontario's adult correctional facilities from 2023-2025. This research is conducted as part of ongoing efforts to understand correctional practices following the *Jahn v. Ontario* settlement [@Ontario_JahnSettlement_2025].

**Principal Investigator:** [Vansh Singh Ruhela](https://orcid.org/0009-0004-1750-3592) [![ORCID](https://orcid.org/sites/default/files/images/orcid_16x16.png)](https://orcid.org/0009-0004-1750-3592)
**Affiliation:** Centre for Criminology & Sociolegal Studies, University of Toronto
**Research Period:** 2023-2026

## Data Source & Citation

This analysis utilizes publicly available administrative data from the Government of Ontario's open data portal:

**Primary Dataset:**
Service Management and Oversight Branch. (2025). *Segregation, restrictive confinement, and deaths in custody of inmates in Ontario's adult correctional system* [Dataset]. Government of Ontario. <https://data.ontario.ca/dataset/data-on-inmates-in-ontario> [@Ontario_SOLGEN_DataOnInmatesOntario_2025]

**Data Collection Authority:**
Data is collected and maintained by the Business Intelligence and Insights Branch of the Ministry of the Solicitor General pursuant to the *Ministry of the Solicitor General Act*, R.S.O. 1990, c. M.17 [@Ontario_MCSCS_Act] and disclosed under the *Jahn v. Ontario* settlement agreement [@Ontario_JahnSettlement_2025].

**Programmatic Access:**
Researchers can access the data programmatically via the CKAN Data API [@Ontario_CKAN_API_2025]:
```
https://data.ontario.ca/api/3/action/datastore_search?resource_id=5a0c5804-a055-4031-9743-73f556e43bb4
```

## Methodology

This research employs advanced causal inference techniques including Double/Debiased Machine Learning [@Chernozhukov_etal_2018; @doubleml2024R] implemented through the DoubleML framework for R [@doubleml2024R] and mlr3 ecosystem [@Lang_etal_mlr3_2019]. Data manipulation and visualization utilize the data.table [@datatable_2025] and tidyverse [@dplyr_2025] packages.

## Export Options

This report is available in multiple formats for accessibility and reproducibility:
